title: Record Examination: General Test
Knowledge / skills tested: Analytical writing, quantitative reasoning and verbal reasoning.
Purpose: Admissions to master's and doctoral degree programs in various universities
Duration: About 3 hours and 45 minutes (includes 1-minute breaks after each section and a 10-minute break after third section)
Score / grade range: Analytical writing: 0.0 to 6.0 (in 0.5-point increments),  ,  Verbal reasoning: 130 to 170 (in 1-point increments),  ,  Quantitative reasoning: 130 to 170 (in 1-point increments).
Offered: Computer-based test: Multiple times a year (depends on availability of the test center)  , Paper-based test: Up to 3 times a year in October, November and February
Restrictions on attempts: Computer-based test: Can be taken only once after 21 days from the day of exam in every year. Maximum of 5 times a year. (Applies even if candidate cancels scores on a test taken previously.)  , Paper-based test: Can be taken as often as it is offered.
Countries / regions: About 1,000 test centers in more than 160 countries  , (Paper-based test offered only in areas where computer-based testing is not available.)
Prerequisites / eligibility criteria: No official prerequisite. Intended for bachelor's degree graduates and undergraduate students who are about to graduate. Fluency in English assumed.
Fee: US$ 205 , (Limited offers of "Fee Reduction Program" for U.S. citizens or resident aliens who demonstrate financial need, and for national programs in United States that work with underrepresented groups.)
Scores / grades used by: Most graduate schools in USA, and few in other countries
